parts: Search for very long term charts of the gold price

content.text: search("Search for very long term charts of the gold price")

parts:
For a comprehensive view of gold prices over the long term, several resources provide extensive historical data and interactive charts:

---

### 📈 1. Macrotrends: 100-Year Historical Gold Price Chart

Macrotrends offers an interactive chart displaying both nominal and inflation-adjusted gold prices per ounce, dating back to 1915. The data is adjusted using the Consumer Price Index (CPI), allowing for a clear understanding of gold's real value over time. As of April 15, 2025, the current price of gold is $3,228.41 per ounce. citeturn0search0

---

### 📜 2. National Mining Association: Historical Gold Prices (1833–Present)

This PDF document provides a detailed annual record of gold prices from 1833 to the present. It includes prices from 1883 to 1994, sourced from the World Gold Council, and data from 1995 onward based on the London PM fix. The document highlights the stability of gold prices for extended periods, such as the fixed price of $20.67 per ounce from 1834 until 1933. citeturn0search1

---

### 🌐 3. GoldPrice.org: Extensive Historical Gold Charts

GoldPrice.org provides a variety of gold price charts covering different time frames, including 1-year, 5-year, 10-year, 20-year, 30-year, and all available data. The site also offers inflation-adjusted gold price history and charts in multiple currencies, such as USD, EUR, GBP, and JPY. Additionally, it links to MeasuringWorth.org, which offers historical gold prices dating back to 1257. citeturn0search2

---

### 📊 4. OnlyGold.com: Over 200 Years of Annual Gold Prices

OnlyGold.com presents a comprehensive table of annual gold prices spanning over two centuries. This resource is valuable for analyzing long-term trends and understanding gold's performance across different historical periods. citeturn0search4

---

### 🧠 5. MeasuringWorth: Historical Gold Prices Since 1257

MeasuringWorth.com offers detailed historical data on gold prices, with records extending back to the year 1257. The site provides various calculators and comparators to analyze the relative economic value of gold over time, making it a useful tool for in-depth historical research. citeturn0search9

---

These resources collectively offer a robust foundation for analyzing gold's price movements over the long term, aiding in research, investment decisions, and understanding economic history.
